The Battle of Porto Novo was fought on 1 July 1781 between forces of the Kingdom of Mysore and British East India Company in the place called Porto Novo (now known as Parangipettai) on the Indian subcontinent, during the Second Anglo-Mysore War. The British force, numbering more than 8,000 men under the command of Sir Eyre Coote defeated a force estimated at 40,000 under the command of Hyder Ali. *Garstin, John Henry. [https://archive.org/details/manualsoutharco00garsgoog/page/n167  Manual of the South Arcot district], pp. 152â€“154.

File:The Battle of Porto Novo.jpg|The Battle of Porto Novo Memorial Park
It is also called the Battle of Chelambram (Chidambaram) One of the most crucial battles ever fought in southern India, after the war known that Hyder Ali ordered not to take any prisoners.
